cutter.forensics.text

Class NGramm

  • java.lang.Object
    • cutter.forensics.text.NGramm

  • public class NGramm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods for ngramm-based text processing
    Author:
    Phil Niehus

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NGramm() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayToList(java.lang.String[] array)
      This method generates a List from a String[]
      static double compareWords(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2)
      Compares how similar two words are
      static NGrammList count(java.util.List<java.lang.String> strings)
      This method generates a NGrammList containing the given Strings and their quantity of occurrence
      static java.lang.String filter(java.lang.String s)
      This method removes the following Chars from the given String: =&%(){}[]\\/\".,;:!'?
      static java.lang.String filter(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String filterChars)
      This method removes a selected set of chars from a String
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllNames(java.lang.String text)
      Searches for all names in a text (Currently only given names or given names+last names).
      static NGrammList getMostRelevantWords(java.lang.String text, int n)
      This method returns the most relevant words from a text and their quantity of occurrence in a NGrammList It's highly recommended to use removeWordsFromText() to remove verbs like 'is' or 'has' to get better results
      static java.lang.String getMostSimilarString(java.lang.String inputText, java.lang.String[] stringPool)
      This method makes it easy to find similar strings to a given one in a given list This could be used for a spam-filter that takes care of spelling mistakes [be aware of words with nearly similar spelling!]
      static double getTextSimilarity(java.lang.String text1, java.lang.String text2, java.lang.String filterChars)
      This method is capable of calculating the similarity of two texts based on a 2,4 and 7-ngramm-analysis This is currently not working good, so i would recommend using the compare contents method
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> ngramm(java.lang.String s, int n)
      Creates a list of ngramms with the length n from a string
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> removeDuplicates(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
      This method removes duplicated items in the given list
      static java.lang.String removeWordsFromText(java.lang.String text, java.util.List<java.lang.String> remove)
      This method removes all words contained in the List from a String
      static java.lang.String removeWordsFromText(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String[] remove)
      This method removes all words contained in the String[] from a String
      static NGrammList sort(NGrammList ngr)
      Sorts an NGrammList in ascending order (very fast algorithm based on Merge-sort)

    • Method Detail

      • getTextSimilarity

        public static double getTextSimilarity(java.lang.String text1,
                                       java.lang.String text2,
                                       java.lang.String filterChars)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is capable of calculating the similarity of two texts based on a 2,4 and 7-ngramm-analysis This is currently not working good, so i would recommend using the compare contents method
        Parameters:
        text1 - First text
        text2 - Second text
        filterChars - Chars contained in this String will be removed from the texts before creating the ngramms
        Returns:
        The similarity between the two texts as a percentage
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAllNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllNames(java.lang.String text)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches for all names in a text (Currently only given names or given names+last names). Detects up to 1 billion combinations of names
        Parameters:
        text - The text to check for names.
        Returns:
        A List containing all the names which were found in the text
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMostRelevantWords

        public static NGrammList getMostRelevantWords(java.lang.String text,
                                              int n)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns the most relevant words from a text and their quantity of occurrence in a NGrammList It's highly recommended to use removeWordsFromText() to remove verbs like 'is' or 'has' to get better results
        Parameters:
        text - The text to take words from
        n - The n most relevant words will be returned
        Returns:
        An NGrammList containing the n most relevant words and their quantity in the text
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • removeWordsFromText

        public static java.lang.String removeWordsFromText(java.lang.String text,
                                                   java.lang.String[] remove)
        This method removes all words contained in the String[] from a String
        Parameters:
        text - The String to remove words from
        remove - An Array of Strings that should be removed from the input
        Returns:
        The String without any unwanted containments

      • removeWordsFromText

        public static java.lang.String removeWordsFromText(java.lang.String text,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> remove)
        This method removes all words contained in the List from a String
        Parameters:
        text - The String to remove words from
        remove - A List of Strings that should be removed from the input
        Returns:
        The String without any unwanted containments

      • arrayToList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayToList(java.lang.String[] array)
        This method generates a List from a String[]
        Parameters:
        array - The String[] to convert into a List
        Returns:
        The converted List

      • getMostSimilarString

        public static java.lang.String getMostSimilarString(java.lang.String inputText,
                                                    java.lang.String[] stringPool)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method makes it easy to find similar strings to a given one in a given list This could be used for a spam-filter that takes care of spelling mistakes [be aware of words with nearly similar spelling!]
        Parameters:
        inputText - The input text that will be checked for the containment of words similar to the ones in the stringPool array
        stringPool -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • compareWords

        public static double compareWords(java.lang.String word1,
                                  java.lang.String word2)
        Compares how similar two words are
        Parameters:
        word1 - First word
        word2 - Second Word
        Returns:
        The similarity between the two words as a percentage

      • count

        public static NGrammList count(java.util.List<java.lang.String> strings)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method generates a NGrammList containing the given Strings and their quantity of occurrence
        Parameters:
        strings - A list containing strings for counting
        Returns:
        Returns an NGrammList containing the quantity for every String (like an associative array in php)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • filter

        public static java.lang.String filter(java.lang.String s)
        This method removes the following Chars from the given String: =&%(){}[]\\/\".,;:!'?
        Parameters:
        s - String for filtering
        Returns:
        Filtered String

      • filter

        public static java.lang.String filter(java.lang.String s,
                                      java.lang.String filterChars)
        This method removes a selected set of chars from a String
        Parameters:
        s - String for filtering
        filterChars - A String containing all Chars that will be removed from the input
        Returns:
        The filtered String

      • ngramm

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> ngramm(java.lang.String s,
                                                      int n)
        Creates a list of ngramms with the length n from a string
        Parameters:
        s - String to create ngramms of
        n - The length for the ngramms
        Returns:
        A list containing all the ngramm-strings (with duplictes! use removeDuplicates() to get a list of unique Strings)

      • removeDuplicates

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> removeDuplicates(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        This method removes duplicated items in the given list
        Parameters:
        list - The list with duplicates
        Returns:
        A list containing only unique items

      • sort

        public static NGrammList sort(NGrammList ngr)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Sorts an NGrammList in ascending order (very fast algorithm based on Merge-sort)
        Parameters:
        ngr - The NGrammList to sort
        Returns:
        The NGrammList in ascending order
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
